bill.title: State Board of Health; require to create database of deceased persons for county election officials.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-57-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Health To Create A Database To Be Accessible To The Local Registrars Of Births And Deaths, The County Election Registrars, The Tax Assessor And The Chairman Of The County Election Commission, Which Contains An Updated List Of The Deaths Of All Persons, By County; To Require The Lists To Include The Full Name (as Recorded On The Death Certificate), Date Of Death, Sex, Race, Age And Usual Place Of Residence Of The Deceased Person; To Amend Section 23-15-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Circuit Clerk Of Each County To Prepare And Keep In His Office A Full And Complete List Of All Deceased Persons In The County Using Information Obtained From The Database Established For Such Purpose By The State Board Of Health; To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; To Bring Forward Section 41-57-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Local Registrar Of Births And Deaths To Supply The Monthly Reports Of Death To The County Registrar, Tax Assessor And The Chairman Of The County Election Commission, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Human Services;Appropriations
